data.title: Latest National News, Videos & Photos - ABC News - ABC News
data.meta_description: Get the  latest breaking news across the U.S. on ABCNews.com
data.text:
Arizona man pleads guilty over threatening to kill FBI agents, politicians

Among Michael Lee Tomasi's threats was a call to kill "corrupt" politicians.

Backpacker dies after suffering 'sudden medical complications' at national park

"She was eventually unable to walk, lost consciousness, and stopped breathing."

ABC News Live Rundown: Wednesday, August 14, 2024

Stay up to date on the developing stories making headlines.

Prime Focus: Life saving tips

ABC News' Jaclyn Lee speaks with officials in the Grand Canyon about safety preparations visitors can take while exploring the natural wonder.

Columbia University President Minouche Shafik resigns months after college protests

Katrina Armstrong, MD, was announced as the interim president.

ABC News Live Prime: Wednesday, August 14, 2024

Ernesto slams Puerto Rico, leaving nearly half the island without power; the surprise Ukrainian attack inside Russia; search and rescue teams on the preparations hikers should now make.

28-year-old mother 'involuntarily' missing for 2 weeks, police say

Mamta Kafle was last seen on July 31 in Manassas Park, Virginia, police said.

Jury hears opening arguments in case of Nevada official accused of killing journalist

Telles' defense attorney has suggested he was framed for murder.

Trump and Harris battle for voters trust on economy

Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump are focusing on voters wallets on the campaign trail. ABC News' Alex Presha discusses the economic points both hit.

Presidential race heating up as November draws closer

We take a look at Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump’s dueling economic policies.

NASA's Mars rover to begin 'most challenging' journey up crater rim

The Perseverance rover will begin the Crater Rim Campaign on Aug. 19.

Ernesto becomes hurricane after leaving 728,000 without power in Puerto Rico

Hurricane Ernesto now has winds of 75 mph.

Convicted murderer escapes on way to hospital: Police

Ramone Alston, 30, was convicted of fatally shooting a 1-year-old girl in 2015.

Suspect identified in break-in at Trump campaign office: Sheriff's office

The burglary was reported Sunday night at the Ashburn office, authorities said.

Vance to head to Hamptons for high-dollar fundraiser next weekend

The event is set to be hosted by a number of big-name Trump donors.

Cold case murder from 1986 linked to serial killer with 13 other victims

Cathy Small was found on a California road suffering from multiple stab wounds.

Ernesto upgraded to a hurricane

ABC meteorologist Somara Theodore tracks Ernesto as it heads toward the East Coast.

1986 cold-case murder is linked to serial killer, authorities say

The 1986 slaying of a 19-year-old woman whose body was found dumped in South Pasadena has been linked to a serial killer who was convicted of murdering 12 women in Riverside County.

1 dead, 2 injured after man drives through Florida strip club

A man drove his semi-truck into the Emperors Gentlemen's Club and was taken into custody, according to city officials.

The safety concerns over cellphone bans in schools

California is proposing such a ban while Virginia announced it will restrict cellphone use in public K-12 schools starting in 2025.

National headlines from ABC News

Catch up on the developing stories making headlines.

Sheriff's deputy hospitalized after being struck by fleeing driver

It's unclear what prompted the traffic stop or what happened moments before.

1 dead, 2 injured after man drives through strip club following argument

“Witnesses reported the driver had just been kicked out of the club."

Lightning strike injures 2 at national park

Two visitors were airlifted to a Utah hospital following the incident.

Hawaiian man charged after police discover homemade bomb near Maui school

Robert Francis Dumaran made an initial appearance in court in Hawaii on Tuesday.

ABC News Live Prime: Tuesday, August 13, 2024

Tropical Storm Ernesto hits the Caribbean; growing fears of possible retaliation by Iran toward Israel; the academy training the next generation of female race car drivers.

ABC News Live Rundown: Tuesday, August 13, 2024

Stay up to date on the developing stories making headlines.

Ernesto highlights fears about Puerto Rico's power grid

Casa Pueblo executive director Arturo Massol discusses the impending storm, and the resiliency work his organization has done since Hurricane Maria devastated Puerto Rico in 2017.

Dr. Nate Smith on discovery of new dinosaur species

ABC News' Juju Chang speaks with Dr. Nate Smith about the discovery of a new species of dinosaur and the journey of piecing the 150-million-year-old giant named Gnatalie back together.

Prosecutors charge former police chief in connection with 2023 newspaper raid

Cody was charged with one count of interfering with a judicial process.

7-foot-long mammoth tusk found in Mississippi creek in rare discovery

Eddie Templeton found the intact tusk while hunting for fossils this month.

Israel preps for attacks, UAW files labor charges against Trump and Musk

Israel braces for retaliatory attacks. Plus, Trump and Musk’s X conversation could lead to federal charges. And, Journey faces legal woes ahead of the band's tour. Our panel weighs in.

Black bear attacks child in tent on Montana campground

The bear was shot and killed the next day, officials said.

UAW files federal labor charges against Donald Trump and Elon Musk

In an interview with Musk, Trump appeared to endorse firing striking workers.

Tim Walz launches solo campaign tour in Los Angeles

The Democratic vice presidential candidate spoke before an audience of union members. The campaign stop was hosted by the American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees convention.

Tropical Storm Ernesto to bring rain, flooding to Puerto Rico: Path

For Puerto Rico, the worst of the storm is Tuesday night into early Wednesday.

Man dies of heat exposure in Death Valley park

A man died of heat exposure in California's Death Valley National Park, marking the park's second heat-related death this summer, according to the National Park Service.

Spice celebrates groundbreaking success, new album 'Mirror 25'

Spice discusses her music career and expresses her desire to pursue acting.
